column2: ITP - 131 - SWD04 Eastern Gully Works Rev E
column8: ITP - 131 - SWD04 Eastern Gully Works Rev E

column2: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - In-Streams works to be carried out between Jan to April. Fish relocation to be carried out by Ecology NZ as per FMP requirements.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - EcologyNZ to inspect trees for fauna prior to removal.
Standard / Specification - Bat Management Plan, Lizard Management Plan
Frequency - 3 initial tests per source of fill
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Boulders to have specific gravity >2.1, be clean and crack-free.
○ The grout shall meet NZS 3109 and be kept wet 12 hours post pour.
○ Grout should be recessed 1/3 the diameter of the boulders' side facing the channel.
○ 48 hrs before grouting, placement must be inspeted by Engineer.
Verifying Document - Material Certs, Concrete Docket
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Density - Greater than 2.40t/m3
○ Weathering Classification - AA, BA, AB or BB
○ Calcite intrusions - Rock shall be free of calcite intrusions
○ Grading - Rock for riprap shall be the nominal D50 size shown on the drawings and shall be well graded.
○ If riprap product is unavailable, alternative material to be approved by designer.
Verifying Document - Delivery Dockets, Lab Reports
○ Blue/brown run of pit material (not too weathered)
○ Wrapped in a geotextile (strength class determined by the clast size of aggregate)
○ Maximum clast size 200mm. All larger blasts to be broken up.
Verifying Document - Delivery Dockets, Proof Roll Testing
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 20MPa Grout mix design to be deemed suitable by designer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NZTA F/07 Strength Class C geotextile installed at the base of undercut.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NZTA F/07 Strength Class E geotextile installed on top of finished rockfill surface. Only required if GCL is installed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Elcoseal GCL to be deemed suitable by designer. X800 grade to be used unless otherwise advised by designer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Confirm pipes diameter, class & jointing type as shown on the drawings, and that the pipes/manholes/catchpits are correct and in good condition and compliant.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pit sand, PAP 5 or an equivalent material approved by Engineer.
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mixed as per manufacturer's requirements
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Super Silt Fencing and Silt Fencing in place as per ESCP Silt Buster to provide sediment control for weir.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Temporary dam constructed via 1m sand bags, stacked up to max 2m height. 600mm rigid pipe at stream level to connect to 600mm flexible flume.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Water from downstream bund to be pumped to Lamella Clarifier and discharged under into the stream further down.
○ Treated discharge into stream to be between pH 5.5-8.5. TSS limit 150mg/l. Turbidity limit 50NTU or 100mm clarity. Non-compliant discharge notified to WRC within 24 hours.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Preparation of the firm to stiff / medium dense subgrade beneath the proposed fill areas should comprise stripping of all vegetation, topsoil, any pre-existing fill materials or weak alluvium followed by benching of the exposed subgrade where natural slopes beneath the fill exceed gradients of nominally 1:5 (vertical to horizontal). CMW to inspect subgrade prior to placement of rockfill.
○ Benching in accordance with CMW sketch detail.
Frequency - Prior to placement and compaction of fill
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Proof rolls at 500mm lifts, to be observed by CMW.
○ Rockfill to be fully wrapped in geotextile filter fabric, strength class c.
○ Wrapping to be inspected by CMW.
○ Upon completion of rock fill instalation, inspection by CMW.
○ Sharp edges of rock (protrusions) to be minimised.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Class C Geotextile to cover the entire base of excavation and be fully wrapped around the rockfill material. Minimum 500mm overlap required.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Class E Geotextile to cover the entire surface of rockfill material between rockfill – GCL interface.
○ CMW to inspect prior once installed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to cover entire surface of rockfill material.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil to cover entire surface of GCL. Minimum 300mm of coverage.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Clegg Testing to be carried out on pipe foundation.
○ Clegg Test to correlate to minimum CBR of 15.
○ Foundation for Manholes/structures to only be measured with Clegg CIV of where there is a rockfill foundation.
○ Other MH's and impact basin structures are to meet the foundation requirement.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - HS2 Bedding under pavement
Standard / Specification - Non cohesive material - Minimum Density Index (DI) of 70 or 95% of MDD, AS/NZS 2566.2/2002
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
5.03.04 - Haunch Zone Compaction Testing - Haunch Zone shall extend from top of bedding to 0.3 times the outside dia of pipe
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm, Minimum Compaction 92% of MDD
Standard / Specification - HS2 backfil Non cohesive material - Minimum Density Index (DI) of 60 or 92% of MDD, AS/NZS 3725:2007
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
5.03.05 - Side Zone Compaction Testing - Side Zone shall extend from top of Haunch Zone to 0.5 times the outside dia of pipe
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm, Minimum Compaction 92% of MDD
Standard / Specification - HS2 backfil Non cohesive material - Minimum Density Index (DI) of 60 or 92% of MDD, AS/NZS 3725:2007
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
5.03.06 - Overlay Compaction Testing - Overlay zone shall extend from top of Side Zone to 600mm above the top of the pipe. 2 lifts of 300mm should be placed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm, Minimum Compaction 92% of MDD
Standard / Specification - HS2 backfil Non cohesive material - Minimum Density Index (DI) of 60 or 92% of MDD, AS/NZS 3725:2007
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Inspection of pipes prior to backfilling to ensure correct installation and that the joints are sealed. No damages caused to the pipeline.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Invert Levels: The permissible deviation from the designated level of the invert at each manhole or structure shall be ± 50mm, provided that the fall between successive manholes or structures shall be at least 90% of that specified.
○ Horizontal Alignment: The permissible deviation of the horizontal alignment between manholes or structures shall be ± 100mm.

○ Gradient: For straight gradients, the permissible deviation from the specified gradient shall be ± 50mm from a straight line drawn between the inverts of successive manholes, provided that no point in the pipeline is lower than any downstream point.
Standard / Specification - Vertical tolerance +/- 50mm, Horizontal Between Structures +/- 100mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm, Testing to be completed on 300mm lifts of backfill - 95% of MDD at OMC (98% Average)
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Riprap Mix Materials to be stockpiled separately and mixed in a pre-determined ratio to make a suitable riprap product
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Riprap layer within 1200mm fish passage to be 400mm high. Pipe laser to be used to ensure compliance.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - CCTV inspection of 750mm stormwater and wastewaterline. CCTV soft copy to be provided to designer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Clegg Testing to be carried out on stormwater manhole foundation. Clegg Test to correlate to minimum CBR of 15.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm, Minimum Compaction 95%(Average98%) of MDD
Standard / Specification - Non cohesive material - Minimum Density Index (DI) of 70 or 95% of MDD, AS/NZS 2566.2/2002
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - HS2 Bedding under pavement
Standard / Specification - Non cohesive material - Minimum Density Index (DI) of 70 or 95% of MDD, AS/NZS 2566.2/2002
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Inspection of manhole prior to backfilling to ensure correct installation and that the joints are sealed. No damages caused to the manhole

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Invert Levels: The permissible deviation from the designated level of the invert at each manhole or structure shall be ± 50mm, provided that the fall between successive manholes or structures shall be at least 90% of that specified.
Horizontal Alignment: The permissible deviation of the horizontal alignment between manholes or structures shall be ± 100mm.

Gradient: For straight gradients, the permissible deviation from the specified gradient shall be ± 50mm from a straight line drawn between the inverts of successive manholes, provided that no point in the pipeline is lower than any downstream point.
Standard / Specification - Vertical tolerance +/- 50mm, Horizontal Between Structures +/- 100mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm, Testing to be completed on 300mm lifts of backfill - 95% of MDD at OMC.
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Frequency - 4 Density test per layer at Quarter Points around the Structure
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All the MH's needs to be haunched as per the specifications
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Undercut/topsoil clearance. Any placed fill. Any drainage undercuts/structures.
